author: Special Correspondent
text:
Usilampatti, Tirupparankundram Assembly constituencies remain exceptions

Except Usilampatti and Tirupparankundram Assembly constituencies, women voters outnumber men in the other eight constituencies of Madurai district.

The final voter figures, which were released here on Monday, reflected that the voter population had crossed the 25-lakh mark, with the total standing at 25,04,543.

District Election Officer K. Veera Raghava Rao said the district had 10 Assembly constituencies – Melur, Madurai East, Sholavandan, Madurai North, Madurai South, Madurai Central, Madurai West, Tirupparankundram, Thirumangalam and Usilampatti.

Apart from men and women voters, others accounted for 80 in the entire district.

According to the data, Madurai East, with a total electorate of 2,86,211 stands to be the biggest constituency, while Madurai South with 2,20,259 voters is the smallest.

A mix

Only Madurai Central constituency falls entirely in the city limits, leaving the rest with a mix of city and rural voters.

Usilampatti has 2,69,103 voters, with 1,526 more men (1,35,313) than women (1,33,787).

Likewise, in Tirupparankundram, out of 2,79,299 voters, men (1,39,832) marginally outnumber women (1,39,445) by 387.

However, the overall figures from the district showed women outnumbering men by 19,843.
title: Women voters outnumber men
